nexus_score.subtitle: The pulse of your financial ecosystem
nexus_score.description: The Nexus Score is a proprietary algorithm that synthesizes your financial health into a single number out of 100. It goes beyond just net worth, evaluating the balance between your debts, savings capacity, net assets, and investment efficiency. A score above 70 indicates excellent financial health.
nexus_score.explain_debt: Debt/Asset Ratio (30 pts): Measures the pressure of your debts on your assets. A perfect score of 30 means your debts are negligible compared to what you own.
nexus_score.explain_savings: Savings Rate (30 pts): Evaluates your budgetary discipline. This pillar rewards your ability to set aside a portion of your income each month for the future.
nexus_score.explain_nw: Net Worth (20 pts): The foundation of your wealth. This score increases as your assets (what you own) exceed your liabilities (what you owe).
nexus_score.explain_perf: Inv. Performance (20 pts): Capital efficiency. This score analyzes if your money is working for you by generating positive returns over time.
nexus_score.advice_debt: Your debt leverage is high. Aggressively focus on repaying 'toxic' debts (interest > 5%) before investing further.
nexus_score.advice_savings: Your savings rate is sub-optimal. Aim for the 50/30/20 rule and automate your savings transfers at the start of the month.
nexus_score.advice_nw: Your net worth is fragile. Prioritize building an emergency fund covering 3 months of expenses before any other action.
nexus_score.advice_perf: Your asset performance is stagnating. Re-evaluate your asset allocation, diversify more, and watch out for management fees eroding your gains.
nexus_score.advice_perfect: Congratulations! Your financial architecture is robust. You are well on your way to financial independence. Now optimize your taxation.

health_radar.subtitle: Multidimensional visualization of your balance
health_radar.explain_safety: Safety (Debt): Your shield against the unexpected. A high score indicates low reliance on debt.
health_radar.explain_growth: Growth (Savings): Your wealth engine. Measures the power of your monthly savings flow.
health_radar.explain_perf: Performance: The velocity of your money. Indicates if your investments are generating traction.
health_radar.explain_wealth: Wealth (Net Worth): The cumulative result. Your financial 'report card' to date.
health_radar.explain_liquidity: Liquidity (Flow): Your financial oxygen. Capacity to generate free cash flow each month after all expenses.

help_perf.modal_intro: This module allows you to precisely track the real profitability of your investments by taking into account your contributions and withdrawals.
help_perf.tab_overview_desc: Visualize a comparative chart between the money you put in (Invested) and the current value of your portfolio. It instantly shows if you are winning or losing.
help_perf.tab_overview_example: If the green line (Value) is above the blue line (Invested), you are making a profit. The gap between the two represents your gain.
help_perf.tab_deposits_desc: This is where you log every amount of money you transfer to your investment accounts. It is crucial for calculating your real performance.
help_perf.tab_deposits_example: On Jan 1st, I transferred $1000 from my checking account to my TFSA. I add an entry: 01/01/2024 | TFSA | $1000.
help_perf.tab_journal_desc: Log the total value of your portfolio here at key dates (e.g., end of month). It's like taking a snapshot of your balance to see the evolution over time.
help_perf.tab_journal_example: On Jan 31st, I log into my bank and see my TFSA is worth $1050. I add a snapshot: 01/31/2024 | $1050. The system calculates I gained $50.
